content.description:
Excellent face climbing up a beautiful knobby face, and a nice long sustained pitch to boot.  This one is a must do!

The first bolt can be clipped by standing on the large obvious foot hold at the start, although getting onto the foothold requires a move.

After clipping the bolt, pull the crux move over the initial bulge, and then enjoy the beautiful sustained knob pulling all the way to the anchor.  Stellar!
content.location: Starts directly behind the large obvious pine tree on the side facing the road.

content.description:
Knob pulling at it's finest!  It's a pity this one isn't longer.

Getting to the first bolt takes some courage, as you have to pull what may be the crux move over a nasty landing to get to it.
content.protection:
4 bolts + a 2 bolt anchor.  You can also place a cam under the overlap between the 2nd and 3rd bolts if you like.

Also, don't forget to bring either some courage or a stick clip for the start.
content.location: On the side facing the road, this climb is on the far left, and ends under an obvious large roof.

content.description:
Start up Midnight Visitor for the first 3 bolts, then do a delicate traverse right, passing one bolt and then joining up with the top of Junkie Cosmonaut.  When you get to the anchors at the top of Junkie Cosmonaut, keep climbing onto the next pitch, which is called Shades of Grey.

Overall this felt less sustained than the neighboring Midnight Visitor/After Midnight linkup, but it has a couple steep tricky cruxes that take some figuring out and demand strong toes.
content.protection: 15 bolts plus a three bolt anchor
content.location: Starts at the same place as Midnight Visitor, right next a pine tree at the base of the wall.

content.description:
The crack and flake line that is the first line of bolts left of Backslide. Climb through a hard slot (crux, maybe 5.10?, handjams VERY useful & sharp) into a corner below a massive flake.

Layback and jam the flake to the chains.
content.protection: Bolts. You could probably get gear behind the flake, but it talks, and felt slightly expando.
content.location: First line of bolts left of Backslide.

content.description:
Follow a low angle crack to a chimney with a crack in each corner. The crux is pulling an overhanging bulge in the back of the chimney. The route ends on a ledge with a tree and one bolt (with just a hanger).

Repel with a 70m rope. You could probably us a 60m but may have to down climb a little at the end. Tie stopper knots.

The rock is dirty but could be cleaned up with traffic. There is some weak rock at the top but should clean up too.
content.protection: Standard rack. Doubles in 3 and 4 are nice.
content.location: The route is right at the end of the trail as you get to roadside rock. It’s the left of two obvious crack features. It’s just right of Life Without Beer (the left most route on the formation, 10b) and just left of The Long and Winding Road (the second sport route from the left on the formation, 11d).

content.description:
Bouldery start from 10 feet off the ground (crux) provides spice from the get go (stick clip the first bolt if you want piece of mind).  Stay on the slab at the very left edge.   Second crux is pulling the smaller bulge (grabbing the tree reduces the difficulty). Saunter up the rest of the way to the bolts.

P2 goes up and left. After clipping a couple of bolts, wrap around to the large chimney (use a 48' runner to reduce drag).  Climb the chimney/crack straight up.  Clip the final bolt to gain the summit.
content.protection: P1 has 6 bolts; P2 has 10 bolts.
content.location:
Just left of Midnight Visitor--about 5 feet left of the tree on the edge of the large slab.

While it is possible to rappel the route with a 60m (barely makes the ledge) or 70m rope, a better option is to walk off the bolted 4th class to the South.  Several parties who have rappelled the route have ended up with stuck ropes and required a rescue.

content.description: A fun, unusual sport route that includes a couple chimney sections at the bottom and the top. Mind the crumbling rock on the left side as you start.
content.location: The last route on Roadside Rock. You'll pass Computer Girl and then come to a roof that has several bolts over the lip. Backslide is the rightmost route running along the gentle roof and the left-facing layback.

content.description:
A continuation to Midnight Visitor.  From the Midnight Visitor Anchors, climb up and right, using a crack, and then some more knobby face, past 4 bolts to a higher anchor.

You could link the two climbs into one long pitch . . .

To descend, a double rope rap will get you all the way down, or with one rope do two raps, stopping at the Midnight Visitor anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts + 2 bolt anchor.  If you are linking with Midnight Visitor, bring 13 draws plus something for the anchor on top.
content.location: Up and right from the top of Midnight Visitor.
